metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2376 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the handling of the MXIT protocolin Pidgin. Specially crafted MXIT data sent from the server couldpotentially result in arbitrary code execution. A malicious server or anattacker who intercepts the network traffic can send an invalid size for apacket which will trigger a buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.3').
